trans-unit.source: How to identify scenarios and plan for advanced analytics data processing | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to identify scenarios and plan for advanced analytics data processing | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Plan for advanced analytics by considering a series of key questions.
trans-unit.target: Plan for advanced analytics by considering a series of key questions.

trans-unit.source: How to identify scenarios and plan for advanced analytics data processing
trans-unit.target: How to identify scenarios and plan for advanced analytics data processing

trans-unit.source: What resources should you plan to include when setting up an environment to do advanced analytics processing on a dataset?
trans-unit.target: What resources should you plan to include when setting up an environment to do advanced analytics processing on a dataset?

trans-unit.source: This article suggests a series of questions to ask that will help identify the tasks and resources relevant your scenario.
trans-unit.target: This article suggests a series of questions to ask that will help identify the tasks and resources relevant your scenario.

trans-unit.source: The order of high-level steps for predictive analytics is outlined in the [What is the Cortana Analytics Process (CAP)?](machine-learning-data-science-the-cortana-analytics-process.md) document.
trans-unit.target: The order of high-level steps for predictive analytics is outlined in the [What is the Cortana Analytics Process (CAP)?](machine-learning-data-science-the-cortana-analytics-process.md) document.

trans-unit.source: Each of these steps will require specific resources for the tasks relevant to your particular scenario.
trans-unit.target: Each of these steps will require specific resources for the tasks relevant to your particular scenario.

trans-unit.source: The key questions to identify your scenario concern data logistics, characteristics, the quality of the datasets, and the tools and languages you prefer to do the analysis.
trans-unit.target: The key questions to identify your scenario concern data logistics, characteristics, the quality of the datasets, and the tools and languages you prefer to do the analysis.

trans-unit.source: Logistic questions: data locations and movement
trans-unit.target: Logistic questions: data locations and movement

trans-unit.source: The logistic questions concern the location of the **data source**, the **target destination** in Azure, and requirements for moving the data, including the schedule, amount and resources involved.
trans-unit.target: The logistic questions concern the location of the **data source**, the **target destination** in Azure, and requirements for moving the data, including the schedule, amount and resources involved.

trans-unit.source: The data may need to be moved several times during the analytics process.
trans-unit.target: The data may need to be moved several times during the analytics process.

trans-unit.source: A common scenario is to move local data into some form of storage on Azure and then into Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: A common scenario is to move local data into some form of storage on Azure and then into Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: **What is your data source?** Is it local or in the cloud?
trans-unit.target: **What is your data source?** Is it local or in the cloud?

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The data is publicly available at an HTTP address.
trans-unit.target: The data is publicly available at an HTTP address.

trans-unit.source: The data resides in a local/network file location.
trans-unit.target: The data resides in a local/network file location.

trans-unit.source: The data is in a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: The data is in a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: The data is stored in an Azure storage container
trans-unit.target: The data is stored in an Azure storage container

trans-unit.source: **What is the Azure destination?** Where does it need to be for processing or modeling?
trans-unit.target: **What is the Azure destination?** Where does it need to be for processing or modeling?

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: SQL Azure databases
trans-unit.target: SQL Azure databases

trans-unit.source: SQL Server on Azure VM
trans-unit.target: SQL Server on Azure VM

trans-unit.source: HDInsight (Hadoop on Azure) or Hive tables
trans-unit.target: HDInsight (Hadoop on Azure) or Hive tables

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: Mountable Azure virtual hard disks.
trans-unit.target: Mountable Azure virtual hard disks.

trans-unit.source: **How are you going to move the data?** The procedures and resources available to ingest or load data into a variety of different storage and processing environments are outlined in the following topics.
trans-unit.target: **How are you going to move the data?** The procedures and resources available to ingest or load data into a variety of different storage and processing environments are outlined in the following topics.

trans-unit.source: [Load data into storage environments for analytics](machine-learning-data-science-ingest-data.md)
trans-unit.target: [Load data into storage environments for analytics](machine-learning-data-science-ingest-data.md)

trans-unit.source: [Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources](machine-learning-data-science-import-data,md).
trans-unit.target: [Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources](machine-learning-data-science-import-data,md).

trans-unit.source: **Does the data need to be moved on a regular schedule or modified during migration?** Consider using Azure Data Factory (ADF) when data needs to be continually migrated, particularly if a hybrid scenario that accesses both on-premise and cloud resources is involved, or when the data is transacted or needs to be modified or have business logic added to it in the course of being migrated.
trans-unit.target: **Does the data need to be moved on a regular schedule or modified during migration?** Consider using Azure Data Factory (ADF) when data needs to be continually migrated, particularly if a hybrid scenario that accesses both on-premise and cloud resources is involved, or when the data is transacted or needs to be modified or have business logic added to it in the course of being migrated.

trans-unit.source: For further information, see [Move data from an on-premise SQL server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-azure-adf.md)
trans-unit.target: For further information, see [Move data from an on-premise SQL server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-azure-adf.md)

trans-unit.source: **How much of the data is to be moved to Azure?** Datasets that are very large may exceed the storage capacity of certain environments.
trans-unit.target: **How much of the data is to be moved to Azure?** Datasets that are very large may exceed the storage capacity of certain environments.

trans-unit.source: For an example, see the discussion of size limits for Machine Learning Studio in the next section.
trans-unit.target: For an example, see the discussion of size limits for Machine Learning Studio in the next section.

trans-unit.source: In such cases a sample of the data may be used during the analysis.
trans-unit.target: In such cases a sample of the data may be used during the analysis.

trans-unit.source: For details of how to down-sample a dataset in various Azure environments, see [Sample data in the Cortana Analytics Process](machine-learning-data-science-sample-data.md).
trans-unit.target: For details of how to down-sample a dataset in various Azure environments, see [Sample data in the Cortana Analytics Process](machine-learning-data-science-sample-data.md).

trans-unit.source: Data characteristics questions: type, format and size
trans-unit.target: Data characteristics questions: type, format and size

trans-unit.source: These questions are key to planning your storage and processing environments, each of which are appropriate to various types of data and each of which have certain restrictions.
trans-unit.target: These questions are key to planning your storage and processing environments, each of which are appropriate to various types of data and each of which have certain restrictions.

trans-unit.source: **What are the data types?** For Example:
trans-unit.target: **What are the data types?** For Example:

trans-unit.source: Numerical
trans-unit.target: Numerical

trans-unit.source: Categorical
trans-unit.target: Categorical

trans-unit.source: Strings
trans-unit.target: Strings

trans-unit.source: Binary
trans-unit.target: Binary

trans-unit.source: **How is your data formatted?** For Example:
trans-unit.target: **How is your data formatted?** For Example:

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated (CSV) or tab-separated (TSV) flat files
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated (CSV) or tab-separated (TSV) flat files

trans-unit.source: Compressed or uncompressed
trans-unit.target: Compressed or uncompressed

trans-unit.source: Azure blobs
trans-unit.target: Azure blobs

trans-unit.source: Hadoop Hive tables
trans-unit.target: Hadoop Hive tables

trans-unit.source: SQL Server tables
trans-unit.target: SQL Server tables

trans-unit.source: **How large is your data?**
trans-unit.target: **How large is your data?**

trans-unit.source: Small: Less than 2GB
trans-unit.target: Small: Less than 2GB

trans-unit.source: Medium: Greater than 2GB and less than 10GB
trans-unit.target: Medium: Greater than 2GB and less than 10GB

trans-unit.source: Large: Greater than 10GB
trans-unit.target: Large: Greater than 10GB

trans-unit.source: Take the Azure Machine Learning Studio environment for example:
trans-unit.target: Take the Azure Machine Learning Studio environment for example:

trans-unit.source: For a list of the data formats and types supported by Azure Machine Learning Studio, see [Data formats and data types supported](machine-learning-data-science-import-data.md#data-formats-and-data-types-supported) section.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the data formats and types supported by Azure Machine Learning Studio, see [Data formats and data types supported](machine-learning-data-science-import-data.md#data-formats-and-data-types-supported) section.

trans-unit.source: For information on data limitations for Azure Machine Learning Studio, see the **How large can the data set be for my modules?** section of [Importing and exporting data for Machine Learning](machine-learning-faq.md#machine-learning-studio-questions)
trans-unit.target: For information on data limitations for Azure Machine Learning Studio, see the **How large can the data set be for my modules?** section of [Importing and exporting data for Machine Learning](machine-learning-faq.md#machine-learning-studio-questions)

trans-unit.source: For information on the limitations of other Azure services used in the analytics process, see [Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints](azure-subscription-service-limits.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on the limitations of other Azure services used in the analytics process, see [Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints](azure-subscription-service-limits.md).

trans-unit.source: Data quality questions: exploration and pre-processing
trans-unit.target: Data quality questions: exploration and pre-processing

trans-unit.source: **What do you know about your data?** Explore data when you need to gain an understand its basic characteristics.
trans-unit.target: **What do you know about your data?** Explore data when you need to gain an understand its basic characteristics.

trans-unit.source: What patterns or trends it exhibits, what outliers is has or how many values are missing.
trans-unit.target: What patterns or trends it exhibits, what outliers is has or how many values are missing.

trans-unit.source: This step is important for determining the extent of pre-processing needed, for formulating hypotheses that could suggest the most appropriate features or type of analysis, and for formulating plans for additional data collection.
trans-unit.target: This step is important for determining the extent of pre-processing needed, for formulating hypotheses that could suggest the most appropriate features or type of analysis, and for formulating plans for additional data collection.

trans-unit.source: Calculating descriptive statistics and plotting visualizations are useful techniques for data inspection.
trans-unit.target: Calculating descriptive statistics and plotting visualizations are useful techniques for data inspection.

trans-unit.source: For details of how to explore a dataset in various Azure environments, see [Explore data in the Cortana Analytics Process](machine-learning-data-science-explore-data.md).
trans-unit.target: For details of how to explore a dataset in various Azure environments, see [Explore data in the Cortana Analytics Process](machine-learning-data-science-explore-data.md).

trans-unit.source: **Does the data require pre-processing or cleaning?** Pre-processing and cleaning data are important tasks that typically must be conducted before dataset can be used effectively for machine learning.
trans-unit.target: **Does the data require pre-processing or cleaning?** Pre-processing and cleaning data are important tasks that typically must be conducted before dataset can be used effectively for machine learning.

trans-unit.source: Raw data is often noisy and unreliable, and may be missing values.
trans-unit.target: Raw data is often noisy and unreliable, and may be missing values.

trans-unit.source: Using such data for modeling can produce misleading results.
trans-unit.target: Using such data for modeling can produce misleading results.

trans-unit.source: For a description, see [Tasks to prepare data for enhanced machine learning](machine-learning-data-science-prepare-data.md).
trans-unit.target: For a description, see [Tasks to prepare data for enhanced machine learning](machine-learning-data-science-prepare-data.md).

trans-unit.source: Tools and languages questions
trans-unit.target: Tools and languages questions

trans-unit.source: There are lots of options here depending on what languages and development environments or tools you need or are most conformable using.
trans-unit.target: There are lots of options here depending on what languages and development environments or tools you need or are most conformable using.

trans-unit.source: **What languages do you prefer to use for analysis?**
trans-unit.target: **What languages do you prefer to use for analysis?**

trans-unit.source: R
trans-unit.target: R

trans-unit.source: Python
trans-unit.target: Python

trans-unit.source: SQL
trans-unit.target: SQL

trans-unit.source: **What tools should you use for data analysis?**
trans-unit.target: **What tools should you use for data analysis?**

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Azure Powershell](powershell-install-configure.md) - a script language used to administer your Azure resources in a script language.
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Azure Powershell](powershell-install-configure.md) - a script language used to administer your Azure resources in a script language.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio/)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio/)

trans-unit.source: [Revolution Analytics](http://www.revolutionanalytics.com/revolution-r-open)
trans-unit.target: [Revolution Analytics](http://www.revolutionanalytics.com/revolution-r-open)

trans-unit.source: [RStudio](http://www.rstudio.com)
trans-unit.target: [RStudio](http://www.rstudio.com)

trans-unit.source: [Python Tools for Visual Studio](http://microsoft.github.io/PTVS/)
trans-unit.target: [Python Tools for Visual Studio](http://microsoft.github.io/PTVS/)

trans-unit.source: [Anaconda](https://www.continuum.io/why-anaconda)
trans-unit.target: [Anaconda](https://www.continuum.io/why-anaconda)

trans-unit.source: [Jupiter notebooks](http://jupyter.org/)
trans-unit.target: [Jupiter notebooks](http://jupyter.org/)

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Power BI](http://powerbi.microsoft.com)
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Power BI](http://powerbi.microsoft.com)

trans-unit.source: Identify your advanced analytics scenario
trans-unit.target: Identify your advanced analytics scenario

trans-unit.source: Once you have answered the questions in the previous section, you are ready to determine which scenario best fits your case.
trans-unit.target: Once you have answered the questions in the previous section, you are ready to determine which scenario best fits your case.

trans-unit.source: The sample scenarios are outlined in [Scenarios for advanced analytics in Azure Machine Learning](../machine-learning-data-science-plan-sample-scenarios.md).
trans-unit.target: The sample scenarios are outlined in [Scenarios for advanced analytics in Azure Machine Learning](../machine-learning-data-science-plan-sample-scenarios.md).
